metadata.title: CVE-2022-39251 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Matrix Javascript SDK is the Matrix Client-Server SDK for JavaScript. Priorto version 19.7.0, an attacker cooperating with a malicious homeserver canconstruct messages that legitimately appear to have come from anotherperson, without any indication such as a grey shield. Additionally, asophisticated attacker cooperating with a malicious homeserver could employthis vulnerability to perform a targeted attack in order to send faketo-device messages appearing to originate from another user. This canallow, for example, to inject the key backup secret during aself-verification, to make a targeted device start using a malicious keybackup spoofed by the homeserver. These attacks are possible due to aprotocol confusion vulnerability that accepts to-device messages encryptedwith Megolm instead of Olm. Starting with version 19.7.0, matrix-js-sdk hasbeen modified to only accept Olm-encrypted to-device messages. Out ofcaution, several other checks have been audited or added. This attackrequires coordination between a malicious home server and an attacker, sothose who trust their home servers do not need a workaround.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-39251` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-matrix-js-sdk package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
